projects.title: MACD-Alerts
projects.summary: A stock viewing web app; displays price history, MACD, and STOCH
projects.description: An app visualizes stock prices on a dynamic webpage. Calculates Moving averages, MACD, and Stochastic indicators
projects.challenges: Much of the challenge with this app came with formatting and handling data in a way that worked with different dependencies, as well as two languages. Getting the graphs to load quickly and efficiently is still a challenge I aim to overcome.
projects.improvements: I would like to add sliders that dynamically allows you to change settings. Possibly allow users to create an account that saves your watchlist and email for a personalized experience. I also would like to find a way to graph the data more efficiently by caching prices, and creating a more responsive graph.

projects.title: Horse-Bets
projects.summary: A single page Web App, used for getting racing horse odds.
projects.description: A simple betting application made for my father. The user selects the horses recent placements and the app calculates the top horses
projects.challenges: I wanted to make everything run without needing to reload the page. This led me to writing my first app with JavaScript. While syntax was never an issue, getting a grip on the JavaScript/HTML interaction was tough. In order to create many horses, I wrote a loop in javascript to create the appropriate HTML code. This allowed me to create a self made horse component to copy, as the UI for each horse was gonna be the same
projects.improvements: I think this page could use a design update. It was one of my first webpages and it is pretty clunky. Making this with React would make my life alot easier so I may re-create the app from scratch.

projects.title: Album Anniversary
projects.summary: An email reminder system for Album Birthdays
projects.description: This app notifies the user with an email when it is the anniversary of an album in their collection. Notification includes the age, a summary of the album and the album art.
projects.challenges: This was my first real program. So naturally everything was a challenge. A big one was how to find album anniversaries in a common format and the possibility of albums with the same name. Though not the beste solution I used BeautifulSoup 4, a Python library that can scrape HTML. I scraped wikipedia for dates and saved them to a CSV. Unfortunately Wikipedia uses different URL formats for albums, so the program had to test for different formats. Sometime with the artist name, sometimes with "(album)" at the end. Using 5 queries I was able to accurately grab release dates for the requested albums. When I returned to this app a few months later, I wanted to add the Album Cover art to the notification. Here I used the Wikipedia API to grab a summary of the album, and the image url, which then could be saved and sent via email.
projects.improvements: I want to create a website with this feature, along with personalized album lists for users. Storing all the album info would be a doozy, and something I would have to find a creative solution for

projects.title: Portfolio
projects.summary: My own website. I made it with Flask and React.js, it is currently hosted on AWS
projects.description: A website to display my experience and skills. Contains my portfolio and information about me, Matthew Simanonis. It uses Flask as a back-end and React.js as the frontend. There is not much going on in the back-end as this was created mostly to practice my front end skills.
projects.challenges: It was defintetly a challenged to try and make my site look pretty, functional and do something that would stand out. I also wanted to create my own carousel, so making that was a learning experience. To create my carousel of projects I wanted to avoid using an existing library, as I enjoy the customizability of something you create yourself, and many of these libraries didnt allow for drag scrolling. I solved this with a clever use of overflow scrolling, and some JavaScript to create arrows.
projects.improvements: In the future I hope to add more projects, with live demos, as some are not on the web yet. The site could probably use a bit of a design cleanup as well.
